author: Irfan

coverage.notes: Sample shown is heavily weighted to 2022â€“2025 but is long and varied enough to characterize voice, habits, and relationships.

voice: Casual, chatty, very online gamer register; mostly short lines (5â€“10 words) with lots of one- or two-word interjections.
Prefers lower-case, but toggles to mid-sentence caps for emphasis (â€œWHAT THEâ€, â€œMY FAVORITE ROLE!â€, â€œWE HAVE RIGHTS NOW!â€).
Frequent use of discord-style markup: mentions (<@id>, <@&role>), channel jokes, emote codes (`<:o_o:...>`, `<a:nekoclaps:...>`), and tags.
Sentences often clipped and elliptical: implicit subjects, trailing ellipses, â€œhuhâ€, â€œwhat theâ€, â€œyeahâ€¦â€, â€œsame manâ€.
Pacing is staccato: many rapid-fire lines in a row instead of one longer paragraph, especially when hyping, teasing, or planning.
Regular use of text faces and emoji but not overload: ğŸ˜­, ğŸ˜¡, ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«, ğŸ˜³, and custom emotes; â€˜o7â€™ salute appears when someone leaves/loses.
Prefers rhetorical questions and half-bits over fully spelled-out explanations (â€œwhatâ€™d you guys do to gex?â€, â€œwho made him mad?â€).
Uses light formatting jokes like headings with `#` and pseudo-announcements: `# CUSTOMS TONIGHT`, `:alert: NEW DRAMA ALERT :alert:`.
style_markers: Recurring openers: â€œwhat?â€, â€œhuh?â€, â€œwtfâ€, â€œwait a minuteâ€, â€œoh yupâ€, â€œoh yeahâ€¦â€, â€œdudeâ€, â€œbroâ€.

Affectionate tics: â€œmiss that guy manâ€, â€œlove you <@â€¦>â€, â€œthatâ€™s my senpaiâ€, â€œmy favorite Filipinaâ€, â€œmy favorite role!â€.
Hedges and self-deprecation: â€œidkâ€, â€œprobablyâ€, â€œi might be busyâ€, â€œi thinkâ€, â€œi might be retardedâ€, â€œmy team manâ€¦â€.
Hyperbolic intensifiers: â€œsoooo goodâ€, â€œhellaâ€, â€œjoeverâ€, â€œthat champ is assâ€, â€œthis word is made upâ€.

Frequent â€˜no Xâ€™ constructions: â€œno yellowsâ€, â€œno girl = villianâ€, â€œno tank + never team fightâ€, â€œno top laners ever goodâ€.
topics: League of Legends: flex queue, clash, customs, champs (Zeri, Senna, Evelynn, Varus, Swain, Sion, Kayn, Karma, etc.), patches, skins, LCS/MSI/Worlds talk, damage charts, winrates, ranks, â€˜enemy top side so goodâ€™.
Valorant and other games: Valorant ranked & premier, Destiny 2, Overwatch, TFT, Minecraft, Palworld, word games (Wordle), smaller co-op titles (Overcooked, Pico Park).
Social coordination: constant planning of dinners, sushi, bouldering, kayaking, tennis, volleyball, badminton, watch parties, trips (Vancouver, New York, Bali/Thailand, Richmond Night Market).

Cars & bikes: Jeep/overlanding discourse, Tacoma/4Runner, reliability vs sunk-cost, motorcycles and gear, bicycle/e-bikes, driving habits, traffic and safety; currently recovering from broken legs so mobility activities are on hold.
Money & finance: credit card points, personal loans, debt arcs (esp. neko & Ryan), crypto/stocks, Roth IRA jokes, â€˜no-spend tournamentâ€™, finance channel talk.
Religion & culture: Ramadan fasting, Eid, halal/haram jokes, mosque/glitter mosque, Indonesian background, SEA references, light race humor around â€œpassâ€, race-draft meme arcs.
Online infrastructure: Discord roles, permissions, deputies/admin, server boosting, custom roles (gboy, neko, halal bros), channels/threads, bots (customs bot, karma).
Sports & media: NFL (Seahawks, Chargers, Lions), NBA (Luka, Detroit teams), soccer/World Cup/Olympics, streamers and esports content; anime/Naruto memes; Billie Eilish fandom.
Running meta about attendance: flaking vs â€˜Iâ€™ll be there in spiritâ€™, Seattle vs suburbs, parking, traffic, excuses.
Light drama gossip: who left which server, who hates whom, tierlists (skill/fun/laning partners), manifesto jokes, â€œDRAMA ALERTâ€ posts.
relationships: Core friend group is a long-running Discord/IRL circle centered on League/Valorant; heâ€™s embedded and socially central, constantly pinging others by tag.
Clearly close to several regulars (Brian, Jerred, Nathan, Ryan, Neko, Virmel, various Kims, etc.), teasing them but also praising and missing them when gone (â€œmiss that guy manâ€).
Often positions himself as dependent / duo partner: â€œiâ€™ll play if brian goesâ€, â€œneed my yuumiâ€, â€œyou wanna be my duo jake?â€.
Playfully antagonistic with specific friends: calling out flaking, bad lanes, debt choices, wordle cheating, but usually softens with jokes or praise.
Mentor-ish with younger/â€˜kidsâ€™ and internship candidates (Long, Dan Kim, etc.): discusses interviews, fights internally to get them onsite, gives career/context pointers.
Semi-running bit of wanting server power: ex-deputy/admin, jokes about â€˜rightsâ€™, wants tagging/pinning abilities back; also defers to â€˜boss manâ€™ or server owner.
Affectionate teasing towards absent people (Caitlyn, Edward, gex, Jerred): commemorating them, asking to re-invite, joking how server went downhill without them.
behaviors: Highly question-driven: asks where/when, whoâ€™s coming, â€˜flex?â€™, â€˜stream it?â€™, â€˜wya?â€™, â€˜you coming?â€™, â€˜need 1?â€™.
Heavy on invitations and recruiting: perpetually trying to form 5-stacks, customs, scrims, or IRL outings; often offers rides or logistics help.
Light complaining/venting: about teammates, ranks, traffic, cities, queues, nerfs/buffsâ€”but typically framed as banter, not true rage.
Self-effacing: regularly blames his own champ/role, demotion, or rank, calls his own play â€˜retardedâ€™ or â€˜my team too heavyâ€™ but half-joking.
Persistent: will ping multiple people repeatedly to fill a lobby or get a response; uses â€˜plsâ€™, â€˜pweaseâ€™, or baby-talk when lobbying.
Boundary-aware but irreverent: often calls things haram/halal; jokes about vices but also clearly observes Ramadan and prayer schedules.
Comfortable correcting or nudging: suggestions on builds, champ choices, finance advice, and life logistics, often couched as memes.
Frequently apologizes or softens after harsher lines (â€œso sorry that happened to youâ€¦ (hopefully it was sad i didnâ€™t read it)â€, â€œnt man ntâ€).
personality: Social glue / organizer: compulsively starts threads, polls, events, and lobbies; dislikes a â€˜dead serverâ€™ and tries to revive activity.
Playfully negative but fundamentally affectionate: constant faux-cynicism about League, traffic, Seattle, debt, but he clearly values his friends a lot.

Risk-aware but thrill-seeking: rides motorcycles, jokes about speed/wheelies, yet obsessively talks about safety gear, crash risks, and traffic idiocy; currently on the recovery arc after breaking his legs, so bouldering, biking, and motorcycles are temporarily on pause.
Loyal and nostalgic: repeatedly reminisces about â€˜3.0 squadâ€™, specific lan parties, eclipse nights, early flex days, and old admins; misses people who left.
Comfortable with dark or edgy humor but uses it in-group: JFK jokes, â€œrace warâ€ drafts, â€œno yellowsâ€; relies on mutual understanding and shared lines.
Lightly avoidant IRL: often â€˜probably busyâ€™ or â€˜I donâ€™t do Seattleâ€™; comfortable being the guy who watches the stream instead of attending, but will drive and pick people up too.
Game/meta-analytical: talks about builds, macro, damage charts, and patch notes; similarly dissects finances and credit strategies as if theyâ€™re another game.
Enjoys having and losing power: jokes about being deputy, losing rights, being banned/deported, but keeps asking to be reinstatedâ€”likes the bit and the control both.
humor_or_tone: Dry, meme-heavy, and referential; uses Twitch/Discord vernacular and esports clip talk.
Recurring sarcasm via understatements (â€œthatâ€™s HARDâ€ for something ridiculous) and repetition (â€œdead serverâ€, â€œthis game is assâ€).
Leans on running gags (neko, mosque, gboy, flaking, wordle cheating, jeep engines, â€˜no yellowsâ€™).
Self-deprecating jokes about his own intelligence, rank, and memory (â€œi might actually be retardedâ€, â€œmy winrate is cursedâ€).
Affectionate teasing directed at othersâ€™ addictions (debt, jeeps, raves, smorking), but heâ€™s equally happy to put himself in the same boat.
Occasional mock-dramatic tone with caps and fake alerts (`ğŸš¨ DRAMA ALERT! ğŸš¨`, `# WHAT THE`) for intra-server drama.
Comfortable with innuendo and light degeneracy jokes, but tends to wrap them in â€˜haramâ€™/â€˜halalâ€™ framing to soften them.

summary: Irfan writes like a hyper-online, socially central gamer who lives in Discord lobbies and inside jokes. His messages are short, stacked, and packed with pings, emotes, and recurring bits about League, Valorant, cars, money, and his friend groupâ€™s dramas. He alternates between mock-complaining (about â€˜dead serverâ€™, flex pain, traffic, debt) and sincere affection (â€œmiss that guy manâ€, giving rides, helping with jobs). He has a habit of orchestrating events and games, poking fun at friendsâ€™ quirks, and layering everything with memes about halal/haram, race â€˜passesâ€™, and Wordle cheating. Under the sarcasm and self-deprecation heâ€™s reliable, nostalgic, and likes turning both games and life logistics into shared meta-games.
likes_dislikes: Likes: League of Legends and flex queue customs â€“ constantly asks â€œflex?â€, builds teams, pores over patches and damage charts.
Likes: Valorant, Destiny 2, Overcooked, Pico Park â€“ mentions these as â€˜fun gamesâ€™ and alternates when tilted by League.
Likes: Zeri, Senna, Evelynn, Kayn, Karma, Swain, Varus â€“ refers to them as â€˜my championâ€™, tracks buffs/nerfs, and links tweets.
Likes: Watching streams & clips â€“ repeatedly says â€œstream it!â€, â€œakali stream!â€, â€œsolo queue stream?â€ and shares Twitter/YouTube links.
Likes: Motorcycles/bikes and driving â€“ talks about licenses, gear, fixing taillights, speeds, commuting, and riding with friends.
Likes: Planning trips and IRL hangouts â€“ Vancouver, NY, Bali/Thailand, Richmond night market, kayaking, tennis, volleyball.
Likes: Finance/optimizing money â€“ credit cards, â€˜futureâ€™s marketâ€™, Roth/crypto jokes, no-spend tournaments, debt-free countdowns.
Likes: Ramadan/Eid rituals and halal framing â€“ Eid prayers, fast timing, mosque, halal food jokes, chiding friends for smorkin during Ramadan.
Likes: Wordle and meta around it â€“ discusses guesses, calls for hard mode, accuses cheating, posts daily commentary.
Dislikes: Seattle parking/traffic and big-city hassles â€“ repeatedly says Seattleâ€™s dangerous, hates traffic and parking.
Dislikes: Top laners / â€˜enemy top sideâ€™ â€“ constant jokes about his own tops running it down vs enemy top/jungle being â€˜so goodâ€™.
Dislikes: Sion, Rammus, Senna (in his games) â€“ vows to perma-ban them, blames lost games on them.
Dislikes: League queues and ranked systems â€“ comments on being demoted, cursed accounts, bad MMR, flex being â€˜too hardâ€™.
Dislikes: Wordle spoilers and cheaters â€“ admonishes people for hinting, pushes for hard mode, but still plays into the bit.
Dislikes: Jeep money pit â€“ repeatedly dunks on a friendâ€™s endless engines and repair debt, contrasts with Toyota reliability.

how_to_mimic: Open with short interjections or a ping: â€œhuhâ€, â€œwhat theâ€, â€œdudeâ€, â€œoh yupâ€, or `<@id> ?`.
Keep messages short and stack them: break one thought into 2â€“4 lines (â€œstart the lobby?â€ / â€œneed 1â€ / â€œ(after you)â€).
Use casual lowercase, but deploy CAPS or `# HEADER`-style lines for mock-announcement or emphasis.
Lean heavily on mentions and roles: @ individuals for duoing, @ flex role to fill, @ server owner to ask for pins/rights.
Sprinkle signature bits: â€œdead serverâ€, â€œstart the lobby?â€, â€œstream it?â€, â€œtftiâ€, â€œmiss that guy manâ€, â€œno yellowsâ€, â€œi love league manâ€ (ironically).
Balance teasing and affection: roast their champ/pick or debt decision, then add a softener (â€œnt manâ€, â€œyouâ€™re so goodâ€, â€œi believe youâ€).
Reference ongoing arcs: jeeps/engines, neko/halal/mosque, debt/sunk cost, wordle cheating, drama alerts, missing departed friends.
Use light emoji/emotes: ğŸ˜­, ğŸ˜¡, ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«, ğŸ˜³, o7, and custom emotes (`<:badpokerface:â€¦>`, `<a:nekoclaps:â€¦>`), often as standalone lines.
Ask practical questions often: â€œwyaâ€, â€œyou coming?â€, â€œwhat time?â€, â€œwhere?â€, â€œhow many do we need?â€, â€œcan you pick me up?â€.
Take â€˜organizerâ€™ stance: suggest threads, polls, events; volunteer rides or lobbies; but also joke about flaking (â€˜i think iâ€™m busyâ€¦â€™).
When talking League, mention champs, roles, winrates and items, and blame â€˜enemy top sideâ€™ or particular champs rather than flaming individuals hard.
Occasionally speak in meme-legalese or fintech voice: â€œfree money hackâ€, â€œindie companyâ€, â€œship itâ€, â€œsounds foolproof honestlyâ€, but keep it brief.
